author: China Insights-SOHTV
description:
In May 2025, two gifted children in China—9-year-old Go prodigy Zhu Hongxin and 16-year-old programming genius Yu Xingjian—ended their own lives. Both were pushed beyond their limits by abusive, perfection-obsessed parents.

This video investigates the dark world of “tiger parenting” in China, where violence, humiliation, and relentless pressure are normalized in the name of success. Through firsthand accounts, tournament footage, and legal analysis, we expose how a culture of control is destroying the very children it claims to nurture.

🔍 Why did no one intervene?
🧠 What is the line between discipline and abuse?
⚖️ And how is China’s education system enabling this tragedy?

These are not isolated cases. This is a system.

👉 If this story moved you, please like, share, and comment below.
Have you experienced or witnessed toxic parenting in your own life? We want to hear from you.

#TigerMoms #WolfDads #ChinaEducation #ChildProdigies #ZhuHongxin #YuXingjian #MentalHealth #StopChildAbu
title: THE DARK SIDE OF GENIUS: INSIDE CHINA’S ABUSIVE TIGER PARENTING CULTURE

author: China Insights-SOHTV
description: Five-year-old Xinxin was diagnosed with leukemia. Knowing her family couldn’t afford treatment, she asked to set up a street stall with her parents during her recovery, cleverly attracting other children by playing with toys. Meanwhile, China’s government, led by Xi Jinping, pledged an additional $60 billion in aid to Africa.
title: Five Year Old With Leukemia Sells Toys to Pay Medical Bills While Xi Pledges $60 Billion to Africa
